How to Install canna on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • canna

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install canna on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing canna on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall canna in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install canna, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install canna Using apt

To install canna in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install canna using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install canna

The installation of canna might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install canna Using apt-get

To install canna using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install canna.

sudo apt-get -y install canna

Install canna Using Synaptic

To install canna using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install canna on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for canna. This will display the canna package in the package window, now to install canna, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the canna package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of canna.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install canna Using aptitude

To install canna on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of canna.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install canna using the command aptitude install canna.

sudo aptitude -y install canna

How to Upgrade canna on debian

If you want to upgrade the canna package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade canna using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade canna to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade canna.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade canna sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade canna

Upgrade canna using Aptitude

To upgrade canna using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade canna.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade canna

Upgrade canna using Synaptic

To upgrade canna using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for canna, now right-click canna, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade canna just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall canna on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall canna from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just canna, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove canna

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of canna

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of canna you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge canna

Remove canna using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall canna using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for canna, right-click the canna package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall canna click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install canna on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade canna using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
